abstract_summ: The models could aid in providing reassurance for low risk patients and shield high risk patients from COVID-19 during de-confinement to reduce the virus' impact on morbidity and mortality.The developed tool combines 10 risk factors using simple summation, and defines three risk levels according to the patient's age and number of accumulated risk points - basic risk, high risk and very-high risk (the last two levels are also considered together as the elevated risk group).However, the model is at high risk of bias according to the Prediction model Risk Of Bias ASsessment Tool and has not been externally validated.A list of risk criteria, as defined by the CDC for example, provides a simple solution, but may be too inclusive by classifying a substantial portion of the population at high risk.Study Design and Methods: We developed a prospective registry of all patients tested for COVID-19 in Cleveland Clinic to create individualized risk prediction models.
title_summ: Demonstrating the importance of external validation by investigating the COVID-19 Vulnerability (C-19) Index across an international network of observational healthcare datasetsPerforming risk stratification for COVID-19 when individual level data is not available, the experience of a large healthcare organizationSeek COVER: Development and validation of a personalized risk calculator for COVID-19 outcomes in an international networkA score-based risk model for predicting severe COVID-19 infection as a key component of lockdown exit strategyHemogram Data as a Tool for Decision-making in COVID-19 Management: Applications to Resource Scarcity ScenariosModeling reductions in SARS-CoV-2 transmission and hospital burden achieved by prioritizing testing using a clinical prediction ruleCalculated decisions: COVID-19 calculators during extreme resource-limited situations.Hemogram Data as a Tool for Decision-making in COVID-19 Management: Applications to Resource Scarcity ScenariosHemogram data as a tool for decision-making in COVID-19 management: applications to resource scarcity scenariosPersonalized Predictive Models for Symptomatic COVID-19 Patients Using Basic Preconditions: Hospitalizations, Mortality, and the Need for an ICU or VentilatorIndividualizing risk prediction for positive COVID-19 testing: results from 11,672 patients.Predicting individual risk for COVID19 complications using EMR dataCan we trust the prediction model?Identifying scenarios of benefit or harm from kidney transplantation during the COVID‐19 pandemic: a stochastic simulation and machine learning study
title_abstract_phrases: The models could aid in providing reassurance for low risk patients and shield high risk patients from COVID-19 during de-confinement to reduce the virus' impact on morbidity and mortality.The developed tool combines 10 risk factors using simple summation, and defines three risk levels according to the patient's age and number of accumulated risk points - basic risk, high risk and very-high risk (the last two levels are also considered together as the elevated risk group).However, the model is at high risk of bias according to the Prediction model Risk Of Bias ASsessment Tool and has not been externally validated.Study Design and Methods: We developed a prospective registry of all patients tested for COVID-19 in Cleveland Clinic to create individualized risk prediction models.Here we describe two approaches: a. the use of an existing EMR-based model for predicting complications due to influenza combined with available epidemiological data to create a model that identifies individuals at high risk to develop complications due to COVID-19 and b. a preliminary model that is trained using existing real world COVID-19 data.
